medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed 3 days prior to admission. The patient experienced epigastric pain and nausea/vomiting. Symptoms persisted during the visit, with later reports of chest pain, which the patient referred to as abdominal pain and neck discomfort.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of coronary artery disease, hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) on home oxygen, chronic low back pain, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), hiatal hernia, diverticulosis, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), anemia, chronic kidney disease (CKD), and Lyme disease.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of early myocardial infarction, arrhythmias, cardiomyopathies, or sudden cardiac death. Father died from multiple myeloma, mother from pancreatic cancer. Sister underwent two-vessel CABG, brother had angioplasty. Adult son and daughter have CAD or other medical issues.
